Guidelines

The Thomas E. Ricks Endowment supports the BYU-Idaho faculty in their enrichment, retraining and teaching efforts. Grants cannot be used to purchase equipment or supplies. All faculty are eligible to apply for research, travel, seminar and other grants that will directly benefit students. Students are not eligible to apply for these funds. (For student research funds, see Mentored Student Funds.) Requests for funding can be made up to 18 months in advance of your project start date.

Application & Deadlines

The grant proposal form is available as a downloadable .pdf form. Please limit your responses so as not to exceed the space provided on the proposal form. Do not include attachments. Once you have completed the proposal, make sure your department chair and dean provide comments and their signatures.

Please complete the Grant Proposal Form. Completed proposals (scanned copies will be accepted) should be forwarded to:

Maria Nate
Instructional Development
350 McKay
mail stop 0415
natem@byui.edu

The deadlines for each semester are:

November 1st
March 1st
June 1st

Funding Guidelines (2012)

For your information and reference the following criteria was used when
granting requests:

  • Thomas E. Ricks funds are designated specifically for faculty development. They are not however granted to help fund a faculty member's pursuit of advanced degrees nor do they cover supplies, books, subscriptions, professional association fees, or funding for students.
  • To assist the largest number of faculty, applicants that received $1,000 or more of funding from Thomas E. Ricks in the three previous years may be funded according to the following priority:
  1. Faculty that have not been funded within the last three years
  2. Faculty that were funded three years ago
  3. Faculty that were funded two years ago.
  4. Faculty that were funded in the previous year.
  • Faculty that received less than $1,000 within the last three years, may be funded so that the combined funding from previous years does not exceed $1,000.
  • The combined financial support from the Department and College was considered when reviewing the applications. Thomas E. Ricks grants are intended to be supplemental funding and should not be the primary source of funds.
  • Funding will not be granted for projects that are completed before the application is reviewed.

Notes:

Funding beyond three years will have no bearing on the decision. Funding is awarded upon completion of the project. Adjunct are funded at a reduced percentage. Administrators who teach are funded as adjunct. One-year hires are not funded.

Award Disbursement
Upon approval of the award, you will be notified of the amount of the grant. The funds will be disbursed to your department on a reimbursement basis. Within 1 week of the completion of your project, please:

  1. 1. Prepare a short (one paragraph) description of your experience;
  2. 2. Add up to 4 pictures - jpeg high resolution (if applicable);
  3. 3. Include the account number to which the funds should be transferred.

Completed information should be sent to Maria Nate at the above address. Once all the information has been received, the funds will be transferred to your department's account. If for some reason you are unable to complete your project, please let Maria know so that funds can be made available for other proposals. Should you have any questions about this process, please call Maria Nate at 496-1157.
